intro: Sapium marginatum var. grandifolium, commonly known as the giant cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, orange-red fruits resembling small cups. The fruit contains a sweet, creamy pulp and is rich in nutrients. It is often cultivated for its fruit and has potential uses in the food and cosmetic industries.
